A History Of Tecmo Games!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Library: Fan Fiction, Poetry, Birthday List, Links & Non-Fiction Archive: Non-Fiction Of Interest: A History Of Tecmo Games!
By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, September 25, 2002 - 09:28 pm:

This chart was written and researched solely by Lisa Shock and is ©2002 - 2007, Lisa Shock -all rights reserved, you must have written permission from the author to re-publish this chart in any form, online or offline.

All games listed here are the copyrighted and trademarked property of Tecmo Inc., to whom I am eternally grateful for their support, encouragement, and great games!

All game systems listed here are the registered trademarks of their manufacturers. I thank them for making everything possible: Atari, Microsoft, Nintendo, Sega, and Sony.

PlayStation the Best is what is known as Greatest Hits in the US, and Platinum in PAL regions.

* The game released in the UK as "Monster Rancher" was actually the game known in the US as Monster Rancher 2. Since the first Monster Rancher was never released in the UK, Sony apparently saw no reason to place the "2" in the title. Thus causing endless confusion online ever since.

AbbreviationStands For
C64Commodore 64
DCDreamCast
DSNintendo DS
GBGame Boy
GBCGame Boy Color
GBAGame Boy Advance
GEGenesis
LNXLynx
NESNintendo Entertainment System, Famicom in Japan
SNESSuper Nintendo Entertainment System or Super Famicom if the game is a JP release
MO Mobile -Cell Phone
MSMaster System
PS2PlayStation 2
PSPPlayStation Portable
PSXPlayStation
SNSaturn
TCDTurbo CD System
WiiWii
XboxMicrosoft Xbox
XBX2XBox 2
JPJapan NTSC
NANorth American NTSC
EUEuropean PAL (includes Australia/NZ)


• Released under the older Tehkan company name, which is a contraction of Teikoku Kanzai, the original company name.
*Game is called Tecmo Stackers in the US
**Game published by third party
